commit_message:
Ignore failures when loading nf_conntrack_proto_sctp kernel module

Ignore failures if nf_conntrack_proto_sctp module failed to load.
Since RHEL 7.4, nf_conntrack_proto_sctp module is compiled into the
kernel instead of as a module as the sctp support.
TripleO will still try to load the module to support RHEL 7.3, but
in the future will remove the module management and rely on the kernel
provided in newer versions of RHEL.

Co-Authored-By: Or Idgar <oidgar@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I8f1c841a7c0f3b1247aba2b959b6dfbe43d8cd79
Closes-Bug: 1695885
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/80/474580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $orig_module_list = hiera('kernel_modules') # RHEL 7.4+ specific workaround where this functionality is built into the # kernel instead of being built as a module if $::os['family'] == 'RedHat' and $::os['release']['major'] >= 7 and $::os['release']['minor'] > 3 { $module_names = delete($orig_module_list, 'nf_conntrack_proto_sctp') } else { $module_names = $orig_module_list } create_resources(kmod::load, $module_names, { })

commit_message:
Add reload support to init file

All services except the API service support
the use of SIGHUP to reload config files
without shutting down network sockets (and
perhaps other things).

This patch adds support for reloading the
services instead of just restarting it to
assist with improving rolling upgrades.

Change-Id: Id95cae40f736ea2c84200955fccdb44ea3bc1dd8
(cherry picked from commit 72b3fdcc8e6806391a3f0507c386186f74d7a9f5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/58/475858/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if item.service_name != "cinder-api" %} ExecReload=/bin/kill -HUP $MAINPID {% endif %}

commit_message:
Evaluate 'None' as None in console_attributes.

The config.yaml file suggests None as one
of the possible values of the directive console-access-protocol,
this is wrongly evaluated as a string in the console_attributes
function, which causes the charm to install the pacemaker
resource even when is not required (console-access-protocol = None).

Change-Id: I367b7fd813e044bc6eedca687e837e8adab2dd40
Closes-Bug: #1697693
Depends-On: I98ebbf9f2c7582fae5f466dfc1d224bf66e38a24
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-cloud-controller refs/changes/15/473915/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if console_proto in ('None', ''): console_proto = None

commit_message:
Fix iptables chain name used for UI forwarding

The chain IN_public_allow does not exist, which breaks the undercloud
deployment. Therefore changing it to the default INPUT chain, and doing
an insert to make sure the rules are executed before a final DROP/REJECT
rule on systems running firewalld.

Closes-Bug: 1699453
Change-Id: I32ce9ab5d7d8a4aa113d5f4f9ad95ea76ea8fc61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/54/476054/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: chain: INPUT

commit_message:
Update Site Search

Replaced Google site search by Swiftype search.
Google updating standard site search and placing
query limit + advertisements. Ultimately, entire
program will be deprecated.
Most expedient change that would meet our needs
(including auto-index) was https://swiftype.com/.

Change-Id: Idd204f3c7aa2aa6064ea08e5100c941339952c8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/45/475845/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% include 'swiftype_search_install.html' %} {% include 'swiftype_search.html' %} {% include 'swiftype_search_mobile.html' %}

subject: Preserve pre-existing port when attach interface fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 00:53:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/088722527b8567557f32529a0632106ae6974640', 'message': "Preserve pre-existing port when attach interface fails

When attaching an network interface to a server, the REST API
takes one of three possible inputs:

1. network_id or
2. port_id or
3. requested_id and network_id

It is a failure to request both network_id and port_id.

And you can't specify port_id and requested_id because that
would violate the port/network constraint or fail #3 where
network_id is required if you specify requested_ip.

Given this, we know that in attach_interface if port_id is not
None, it's a pre-existing Neutron port that we didn't create
during allocate_port_for_instance.

We use this knowledge to tell deallocate_port_for_instance that
it should not delete the pre-existing port directly since we
don't have that information in the network info cache.

Change-Id: Ie56f92e2c0c85c0259e364413816c27f85c2b49b
Closes-Bug: #1645175
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-03 00:55:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/118996e151b9cf41e356879c6b0607f19ae6f5f0', 'message': "Preserve pre-existing port when attach interface fails

When attaching an network interface to a server, the REST API
takes one of three possible inputs:

1. network_id or
2. port_id or
3. requested_id and network_id

It is a failure to request both network_id and port_id.

And you can't specify port_id and requested_id because that
would violate the port/network constraint or fail #3 where
network_id is required if you specify requested_ip.

Given this, we know that in attach_interface if port_id is not
None, it's a pre-existing Neutron port that we didn't create
during allocate_port_for_instance.

We use this knowledge to tell deallocate_port_for_instance that
it should not delete the pre-existing port directly since we
don't have that information in the network info cache.

Change-Id: Ie56f92e2c0c85c0259e364413816c27f85c2b49b
Closes-Bug: #1645175
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-03 03:18:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e13b880fe86f7314e3448521266e4275a093fdc4', 'message': "Preserve pre-existing port when attach interface fails

When attaching an network interface to a server, the REST API
takes one of three possible inputs:

1. network_id or
2. port_id or
3. requested_id and network_id

It is a failure to request both network_id and port_id.

And you can't specify port_id and requested_id because that
would violate the port/network constraint or fail #3 where
network_id is required if you specify requested_ip.

Given this, we know that in attach_interface if port_id is not
None, it's a pre-existing Neutron port that we didn't create
during allocate_port_for_instance.

We use this knowledge to tell deallocate_port_for_instance that
it should not delete the pre-existing port directly since we
don't have that information in the network info cache.

This change also fixes some misleading and just plain wrong
parts of the test_attach_interface_failed compute manager test.

Change-Id: Ie56f92e2c0c85c0259e364413816c27f85c2b49b
Closes-Bug: #1645175
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-03 03:21:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/network/api.py', 'nova/network/base_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/88ca491c14341005aa6b22b73e46fe8b9e16ea79', 'message': "Preserve pre-existing port when attach interface fails

takes one of three possible inputs:

1. network_id or
2. port_id or

It is a failure to request both network_id and port_id.

And you can't specify port_id and requested_id because that
would violate the port/network constraint or fail #3 where
network_id is required if you specify requested_ip.

Given this, we know that in attach_interface if port_id is not
None, it's a pre-existing Neutron port that we didn't create
during allocate_port_for_instance.

We use this knowledge to tell deallocate_port_for_instance that
it should not delete the pre-existing port directly since we
don't have that information in the network info cache.

commit_message:
Preserve pre-existing port when attach interface fails

When attaching an network interface to a server, the REST API
takes one of three possible inputs:

1. network_id or
2. port_id or
3. requested_id and network_id

It is a failure to request both network_id and port_id.

And you can't specify port_id and requested_id because that
would violate the port/network constraint or fail #3 where
network_id is required if you specify requested_ip.

Given this, we know that in attach_interface if port_id is not
None, it's a pre-existing Neutron port that we didn't create
during allocate_port_for_instance.

We use this knowledge to tell deallocate_port_for_instance that
it should not delete the pre-existing port directly since we
don't have that information in the network info cache.

This change also fixes some misleading and just plain wrong
parts of the test_attach_interface_failed compute manager test.

Change-Id: Ie56f92e2c0c85c0259e364413816c27f85c2b49b
Closes-Bug: #1645175
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/452577/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Attempt to unbind the port from the instance in case something # failed. Note that port_id is optional so we check for that # first. if port_id is not None: try: self.network_api.deallocate_port_for_instance( context, instance, port_id) except Exception: LOG.warning(_LW("deallocate port %(port_id)s failed"), {'port_id': port_id}, instance=instance)
deleted_lines: try: self.network_api.deallocate_port_for_instance( context, instance, port_id) except Exception: LOG.warning(_LW("deallocate port %(port_id)s failed"), {'port_id': port_id}, instance=instance)

commit_message:
Clarify setting name in external config mechanism

The 'permissions' key from config.json was renamed 'ownership' to match
what the setting really does and be more friendly to new kolla users.

The change introduces the new 'ownership' setting without breaking
backward compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1696090
Change-Id: I15f8d0639e310814de56c33b7f95a5a96465c80c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/76/471376/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - The config.json 'permissions' key was renamed 'ownership' to reflect what it really does. The `set_configs.py` script still understands the 'permissions' key in order to keep backward compatibility but it may be deprecated in a later release.

commit_message:
Limit exposure of network device types to the guest.

Previously, the 'type' of the hypervisor network device, was exposed to
the guest directly. That does not make sense, as
a.) this leaks needless information into the guest
b.) the guest cannot be reasonably expected to make decisions
    based on a type of link that is present underneath the
    virtual device that is presented to the guest.
c.) guests then are forced to either continuously track these types
    or to assume that unknown type is "phy".

This limits the exposure of types to a specific list. Any other
type will be shown to the guest as 'phy'.

Change-Id: Iea458fba29596cd2773d8d3565451af60b02bcca
Closes-Bug: #1642679
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/400883/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # these types have been exposed to guest in the past, # so for legacy behavior, keep using their value as the type. # for any other nic device, the guest should be told it # is 'phy'. legacy_exposed_types = ( 'hyperv', 'vif', model.VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE, model.VIF_TYPE_HW_VEB, model.VIF_TYPE_OVS, model.VIF_TYPE_OVS, model.VIF_TYPE_TAP, model.VIF_TYPE_VHOSTUSER, ) if vif.get('type') in legacy_exposed_types: else: nic_type = 'phy'

commit_message:
Install `ip` everywhere so that we can manage networking

Minimal means really minimal apparently. Install iproute2 tools so that
we can check things like route tables and open ports and such.

Change-Id: I411f3afd2f87b887bfb6e32baaf2968b7dc91fd0

commit_message:
Enable TLS for MySQL's replication traffic

This enables the options so Galera can use TLS for the replication
traffic.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Depends-On: I9252303b92a2805ba83f86a85770db2551a014d3
Change-Id: I2ee3bf4bbda3f65f5b03440ecbc75f14225a2428
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/78/475378/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*ca_file*] # (Optional) The path to the CA file that will be used for the TLS # configuration. It's only used if internal TLS is enabled. # Defaults to undef # # [*certificate_specs*] # (Optional) The specifications to give to certmonger for the certificate # it will create. Note that the certificate nickname must be 'mysql' in # the case of this service. # Example with hiera: # tripleo::profile::base::database::mysql::certificate_specs: # hostname: <overcloud controller fqdn> # service_certificate: <service certificate path> # service_key: <service key path> # principal: "mysql/<overcloud controller fqdn>" # Defaults to {}. # # [*enable_internal_tls*] # (Optional) Whether TLS in the internal network is enabled or not. # Defaults to hiera('enable_internal_tls', false) # $bootstrap_node = hiera('mysql_short_bootstrap_node_name'), $bind_address = $::hostname, $ca_file = undef, $certificate_specs = {}, $enable_internal_tls = hiera('enable_internal_tls', false), $gmcast_listen_addr = hiera('mysql_bind_host'), $step = Integer(hiera('step')), $pcs_tries = hiera('pcs_tries', 20), if $enable_internal_tls { $tls_certfile = $certificate_specs['service_certificate'] $tls_keyfile = $certificate_specs['service_key'] if $ca_file { $tls_ca_options = "socket.ssl_ca=${ca_file}" } else { $tls_ca_options = '' } $tls_options = "socket.ssl_key=${tls_keyfile};socket.ssl_cert=${tls_certfile};${tls_ca_options};" } else { $tls_options = '' } 'wsrep_provider_options' => "gmcast.listen_addr=tcp://${gmcast_listen_addr}:4567;${tls_options}",

commit_message:
Add option to get credentials from mistral context for ansible actions

This gets valid keystone credentials for usage in ansible playbooks.
This is then added as environment variables when runnig the ansible
commands. This is useful when we're using the dynamic inventory from
the tripleo-validations, since it dynamically fetches the nodes from
heat and mistral.

Change-Id: Ifb073ecaee0635cce60ece675088561b748a8d9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/29/475729/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tripleo.ansible.get_credentials_from_context = tripleo_common.actions.ansible:GetOSCredentialsFromContext

commit_message:
reproduce.sh: Fix the dump of devstack-gate hooks

The current coding is just yielding "not found" messages.

    bash-3.2$ function hoge {
    > echo "hi"
    > }
    bash-3.2$ hoge
    hi
    bash-3.2$ declare -fp hoge
    bash: declare: hoge: not found
    bash-3.2$ declare -f hoge
    hoge ()
    {
        echo "hi"
    }
    bash-3.2$

Story: 2001076
Task: 4723
Change-Id: I58ceeb3536a7f7091d621822989668b84280d914
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/49/476149/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Retry remote fetch tasks

Several tasks retrieve data from linuxcontainers.org
which has DNS lookup failures or timeouts relatively
often.

This patch implements several retries before failing
each of these tasks.

Change-Id: Ib38893957f3673017da31182c4fcc095608bdc39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/29/476129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: retries: 5 delay: 2

commit_message:
Add local tgt to lvm

When the instance is in the same host with LVM volume, it's better to use local dev
( eg. /dev/ubuntu50-vg2/volume-9531dcba-16c5-4f1f-8b61-f0043d0b6a15) of lvm volume
for high performence. So this blueprint will add a local tgt for LVM Volume.

Change-Id: I565d8bd3687f0c633cebb71ea197ed7968e1c60c
Blueprint: add-local-tgt-to-lvm
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/80/247880/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Add local tgt to LVM ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/add-local-tgt-to-lvm The purpose of this spec is to add local tgt to LVM for high performence. Problem description =================== For some services, user must use local volume to meet their high performance requirement. Even the instance is in the same host with LVM volume, however, openstack currently only supports iscsi, iser, lio target for LVM volume. Beside,these targets for LVM volume can not provide high disk performance for them.So it's better to use local dev of LVM volume for high performance. Use Cases ========= VM to be able to use local tgt for LVM volume to get high performance, when instance is in the same host with LVM volume Proposed change =============== Firstly, we add local tgt in cinder targets model(eg,/cinder/ volume/targets/local.py). Similar to tgtadm, we create local tgt Class, and implement all necessary methods. A simple example as following: class LOCALTarget(driver.Target): def __init__(): ... def initialize_connection(self, volume, connector): data = {} data['device_path'] = volume['provider_location'] return { 'driver_volume_type': 'local', 'data': data } ... Secondly, we add 'localadm' identification to local tgt in cinder driver base class(eg, cinder/volume/driver.py). In cinder driver base class init method, we add local tgt identification mapping, A simple example as following: def __init__(self, execute=utils.execute, *args, **kwargs): ... self.target_mapping = { ... 'localadm': 'cinder.volume.targets.local.LOCALTarget'} ... Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ When the instance is in the same host with LVM volume, using local tgt cloud get higher performance than iscsi, iser and lio, and so on. We made some performance tests. One writing disk test is as follows: Pre condition: 1) The flavor of VM is 8 vcpu and 8G ram. 2) The volumes of using tgtadm and local tgt are the same local volumes, and both of their size is 40G. 3) we use fio test tool to make this test, test cmd such as: ./fio -filename=/dev/vdb -ioengine=libaio -name=test -direct=1 -iodepth=32 -rw=write -size=5G -bs=4K Here we use IOPS as a performance evaluation index. Test results are as following table. Target type file size 5G 10G 20G local tgt 32145 33459 32173 tgtadm 30975 29951 31053 From the measurement results, the local tgt for LVM volume can be obtained higher performance. Other deployer impact --------------------- User should modify “iscsi_helper = localadm” in Cinder-volume configure file. The iscsi_helper default value is tgtadm. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: wanggang <eric.wanggang@huawei.com> Other contributors: zhangni <zhangni@huawei.com> Work Items ---------- Enhance cinder LVM tgt. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add unit test and tempest test for LVM local tgt . Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Add node's FQDN to mysql certificate request and CA file

This will add the node's FQDN to the mysql certificate request
besides the VIP's FQDN which we already use. This is needed for
adding TLS to the replication traffic. The CA file was also added
as hieradata, since the path will be needed for the TLS
configuration.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I9252303b92a2805ba83f86a85770db2551a014d3

commit_message:
Always create network-environment for deployed-server

Make sure the networking parameters are always defined for
deployed-server. According to the docs, the following
parameters need to be specified:

  parameter_defaults:
    NeutronPublicInterface:
    ControlPlaneDefaultRoute:
    EC2MetadataIp:

Move deployed_server defaults to the extras-common to share
it across overcloud-prep-config and overcloud-deploy roles.

Change-Id: I46efa6d6a6985c4cb77e518f827e027c13e5d0f9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Only sync glance database on major versions

Since Glance doesn't yet have rolling upgrades, nor is the tooling
idempotent, we avoid running the database operations during minor
upgrades to maintain uptime.

Major upgrades will still run the sync operations, and the database will
be synced if there is no existing database regardless of the type of
upgrade.

Change-Id: Icf6cfaea7f8b4afb489228f20fd13b2047a827d0

commit_message:
Replace request mocking in test_httpclient with requests-mock

Similar to the client functions replace the requests mocking in
test_httpclient file with calls to requests-mock. This means we
test the actual data on the wire instead of the exact calls to
requests so they can change in future.

Change-Id: Id65374e14e3b18dfed46f0c78a95ff10502ce785

commit_message:
Make --profile load from environment variables

--profile argument can be loaded from OS_PROFILE environment variables
to avoid repeating --profile in client commands.

Co-Authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ia24144f5858d05566ffa32a329884dc4dd7ec570

commit_message:
Ensure dirs exist for lxc_container_cache_files

This commit adds a task to ensure destination directories exist for each file
in `lxc_conatiner_cache_files`.

Prior to this commit, the `Copy files from deployment host to the container
cache` task would fail if the destination directory did not exist.

Change-Id: Ice7dbe16d57c216392f95f6eb7e3f0a5d392a3eb
Partial-Bug: #1699326
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/18/475918/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Ensure directories exist for lxc_container_cache_files file: dest: "{{ lxc_image_cache_path }}{{ item.dest | default(item.src) | dirname }}" state: directory with_items: "{{ lxc_container_cache_files }}"

commit_message:
Move non-prioritized Pike specs to 'untargeted'

Following discussion at the Glance virtual midcycle meeting, specs
that were approved for Pike but whose owners are no longer available
to work on them are to be moved to an 'untargeted' directory.

Change-Id: I6da5d9ec49e60609173456456bb8635ada6dbdd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/93/469693/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Introduce db sync --check feature --------------------------------- :problem: It is very hard for automation of deploy and upgrade operations to know if there are db migrations pending. It requires the automation to know what the latest version is, and compare that to the output of a command to check the current version, then interpret the potential difference somehow. :solution: Similar to the linked feature added to Keystone's manage command, Glance should support an operation which enumerates any outstanding db upgrade operations and provide a distinct return code based on that status. Each expand, migrate, and contract operation required to upgrade the db should be listed in the proper order of execution in the response. For consistency with Keystone, this may be implemented by using a ``--check`` option. When this option is present no db upgrades would be performed but potential operations would be reported, acting similar to the pattern of a dry-run. :impacts: Introduces new option to the db sync operation in glance-manage. :timeline: Expected to be merged within the Pike time frame. :link: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1642212 :assignee: Open End of `Introduce db sync --check feature` ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ Introduce Glance Taskflow stopfile feature ------------------------------------------ :problem: When preparing to take a Glance node down for maintenance or upgrade it is necessary to allow long-running operations to complete without allowing new operations to begin. The Taskflow engine does not have the capability to prevent individual executors from starting new jobs, and so attempting to take a Glance node out of the Taskflow processing pool risks a race condition with that executor starting a job just before the service is terminated which could cause the Task processing to fail. :solution: Introduce a disable_by_file_path feature to Glance Taskflow which will prevent the node from picking up new jobs. This allows an operator or automation engine to ``touch`` the appropriate file before terminating the service. This feature should depend on the oslo healthcheck middleware configuration to disable the taskflow engine. As an additional impact, this work will require Glance to instantiate a single taskflow engine as a singleton and reuse that engine instance on all subsequent taskflow operations. :impacts: None :timeline: Expected to have a fix merged in the Pike cycle before milestone 2. :link: https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/healthcheck_plugins.html :assignee: Open End of `Introduce Glance Taskflow stopfile feature` +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

commit_message:
Replace voluptuous with JSONSchema to validate sleep action

Now in watcher,both JSONSchema and voluptuous are used to validate
JSON payloads. We want to remove voluptuous and Use
JSONSchema as our only JSON validation tool to keep consistence
and also to make it easier to expose the validation schema
through our API in future work.

In this patch, we replace voluptuous with JSONSchema to validate
the sleep action in watcher applier.

Partially Implements: blueprint jsonschema-validation

Change-Id: I3032490236536a11e7045a56ad0bd40ef979407e

commit_message:
Add OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE in portbindings constants

Added OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE constant in portbindings. This parameter will
be added to OVS backend VIF_DETAILS. This string parameter is used to
define if the bridge uses kernel or userspace datapath.

Change-Id: Ie523c821995c046c7f77783a34e75053fc0abb3d
Related-Bug: #1632372

commit_message:
Add snap package paths to default config dirs

With snap packaging (see snapcraft.io) the package is installed into a
read-only squashfs filesystem, which includes the default config. For
example, $SNAP/etc/nova/nova.conf. To override the defaults, a separate
writable directory is used, and this directory is also unique to the snap.
For example, either $SNAP_COMMON/etc/nova/nova.conf, or
$SNAP_COMMON/etc/nova/nova.conf.d/ can be used to override config.

This patch adds these snap directories to the default config paths where
oslo looks for config.

For more details on $SNAP and $SNAP_COMMON please refer to
https://snapcraft.io/docs/reference/env.

Change-Id: I83627e0f215382aedc7b32163e0303b39e8bccf8
Closes-Bug: 1696830
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/12/474212/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If a project is specified and installed from a snap package, following directories are also returned: ${SNAP}/etc/${project} ${SNAP_COMMON}/etc/${project} Otherwise, if project is not specified, these directories are returned: snap = os.environ['SNAP'] snap_c = os.environ['SNAP_COMMON'] '/etc', os.path.join(snap, "etc", project) if snap and project else None, os.path.join(snap_c, "etc", project) if snap_c and project else None, ${SNAP}/etc/${project} ${SNAP_COMMON}/etc/${project} ${SNAP}/etc/${project} ${SNAP_COMMON}/etc/${project}

commit_message:
Implement db sync and restart facts for upgrades

Rolling upgrades require orchestrating the restart of individual nodes
and the running of database migrations with finer control. Using these
new variables, playbooks can safely restart individual services, then
run the database migrations once every node is updated to avoid data
corruption.

Change-Id: I064f59d9e3550b22de12ebf5595979ff24d90849

commit_message:
Make enabling haproxy stats interface configurable

Some people might or might not want to enable it. So this makes it
configurable. It defaults to true as we were always deploying it before.

Change-Id: I8d2a08cdaf3e5ec3d1a69d4f95e57522508c8610

commit_message:
Use the host python interpreter when delegating to localhost

In order to ensure that the localhost delegated task uses the host
python interpreter (to access host-installed libs like
python-selinux), the interpreter is set on the task.

Change-Id: Ic2a360bfa64f7e3968f0f56f8c46e7b0b5ca57bb
see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/474565/

commit_message:
Normalise distro package installation

This patch makes the distro package list compilation
just a little easier to understand, and avoids the
double evaluation of the variable. It also adds the
spice distro package list which was missing.

It also passes the package list directly to the package
module instead of using a with_items loop and removes
the nested inclusions for distro package installation.

Finally, the async process for installing the packages
is removed as it doesn't give much benefit in terms of
speed and instead obscures the process a little.

Change-Id: I910868db9780d9b56eabf5f059fe2f6d32719238

commit_message:
Add webconsole support in ironic

Add webconsole support in ironic by pxe_ipmitool driver.
Serial speed must be the same as the serial configuration in
the BIOS settings, so that the operating system boot process
can be seen in the web console.

see:
https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/baremetal/draft/advanced.html#appending-kernel-parameters-to-boot-instances

Change-Id: I967ed2f63a50d024c54e0762ec6c0ae09b66d6bd

commit_message:
WIP: gather pod error logs.

Attempt to get logs from pods that would fail to start.
It is to debug vswitchd not starting right in gate.

Change-Id: I6e1ca96d1577f6d4d9681ab64bff35d1e6121d3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/71/472271/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pod_error_logs() { mkdir -p ${LOGS_DIR}/pod-error-logs for pod in `kubectl get pods | awk '!/Running|NAME/{print $1}'`; do set +e kubectl --namespace $1 logs $pod > ${LOGS_DIR}/pod-error-logs/$pod set -e done } kubectl get pods --namespace $1 && pod_erros_logs $1 && exit -1

commit_message:
Use --old-chroot when building RPM packages

New mock by default uses systemd-based chroot for all
run modes (init/build/etc).

Change-Id: I224d120acfd4410024106b0037fe9ceeff87fe1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-mirror refs/changes/26/476126/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: su - abuild -c 'mock -r centos-${DIST_VERSION}-x86_64 --verbose --update --old-chroot' --spec=\$(ls /home/abuild/rpmbuild/*.spec) --old-chroot' --resultdir=/home/abuild/rpmbuild/build \$(ls /home/abuild/rpmbuild/*.src.rpm) --old-chroot'

commit_message:
Support delegation in strategy plugin

The strategy plugin previously did not support container detection
when the delegate_to host was a container. This adds support for
delegating tasks to other containers, so the strategy will perform
the same container vars lookups so the SSH connection is toward the
physical host of the container, and the command is wrapped with
lxc-attach based on the container_name.

This is a backport rolling up the below commits with the addition of
adding a '_get_group_dict' function to the linear strategy since it does
not exist within the inventory class of Ansible 2.1.6:

5af635977ef7f1164a0aa5784ff1bf0992a9d7b2
e566c20b24b085a0d797de534e5e4315413b9f18
d8c0341ab8ad0e17f8e080ccc116ca1a8356363f
8f8d9cfa11d6e1ca9426d53f99b6aa20bd331579
d91d2033615276e39243234640a073d2956ccc18
3ac24525fdce6575e53bcfe326d2f56d607b8989
a556e381641a81f727a496449c72db0837e0608e
8b1a07d2d60cb5e0a48fc152f1eee8a3bc051902

Change-Id: I6fef2d1d7b83bb410b12929007b3a3fae67d24ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/78/475978/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hasattr(self._play_context, 'chroot_path'): self.chroot_path = self._play_context.chroot_path else: self.chroot_path = None if hasattr(self._play_context, 'container_name'): self.container_name = self._play_context.container_name else: self.container_name = None if hasattr(self._play_context, 'physical_host'): self.physical_host = self._play_context.physical_host else: self.physical_host = None def set_host_overrides(self, host, hostvars=None): if self._container_check() or self._chroot_check(): physical_host_addrs = hostvars.get('physical_host_addrs', {}) physical_host_addr = physical_host_addrs.get(self.physical_host, self.physical_host) self.host = self._play_context.remote_addr = physical_host_addr if self._chroot_check(): chroot_command = 'chroot %s' % self.chroot_path cmd = '%s %s' % (chroot_command, cmd) def _chroot_check(self): if self.chroot_path is not None: SSH.display.vvv(u'chroot_path: "%s"' % self.chroot_path) if self.physical_host is not None: u'physical_host: "%s"' % self.physical_host SSH.display.vvv(u'chroot confirmed') return True return False def _container_check(self): if self.container_name is not None: SSH.display.vvv(u'container_name: "%s"' % self.container_name) if self.physical_host is not None: SSH.display.vvv( u'physical_host: "%s"' % self.physical_host ) if self.container_name != self.physical_host:
deleted_lines: self.vars = self._play_context._attributes['vars'] self.container_name = self.vars.get('container_name') self.physical_host = self.vars.get('physical_host') self.physical_hostname = self.vars.get('physical_hostname') if self._container_check(): self.host = self._play_context.remote_addr = self.physical_host def _container_check(self): if self.container_name: SSH.display.vvv(u'container_name: "%s"' % self.container_name) if self.physical_hostname: u'physical_hostname: "%s"' % self.physical_hostname if self.container_name != self.physical_hostname:
